description.S1: A resident of Byzantium, Hortense Ingalsbee,
description.S2: has asked you to investigate the Board's Early Retirement program.

blurb.B1: Gain this quest from speaking with Hortense Ingalsbee in Byzantium.
blurb.B2: begin by accepting the quest from Hortense,
blurb.B3: who will give you a key necessary for the quest.

description.S1: Use the password Hortense gave you to access it via terminal.

blurb.B1: follow the quest marker and proceed to the terminal that controls the door to the Early Retirement District.
blurb.B2: After the zone transition, go forward, interact with another terminal and take the elevator.
blurb.B3: After you finally arrive at the bottom of the elevator,
blurb.B4: you'll be greeted with a gritty looking basement with several hostile Retirement Facilitation Drones,
blurb.B5: as well as many corpses of the retirees.
blurb.B6: It turns out their idea of 'early retirement' is simply murder.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh, splendid! Another rungleech wandering through the streets of Byzantium.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Why, just this morning I thought to myself, "As lovely as the gardens are, what they really need is more greasy vagrants frolicking through them."

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: And here you are... frolicking.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's a rude way to greet someone.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'd hardly call my present attire "greasy."

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What a coincidence, just now I thought, "I'd really like to sock this lady in the face."

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Forgive me if my manners don't live up to the standards of an interloper who accosts total strangers in their own neighborhood.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Honestly, what is the Board thinking, letting so many of your ilk into the city proper? It's madness!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's wrong with more people coming to Byzantium?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If the Board isn't supposed to let people into the city, how'd you get here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yes, I'm sure it is. Now, if you'll excuse me...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm afraid you've mistaken me for someone who cares. So long.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: What's wrong? It erodes the very pillars of our society! Merit! Decorum! Personal hygiene!

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: This city is meant for us, the system's finest! We earned its luxuries.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: But now we are overrun with the unworthy and the ungrateful, and this Early Retirement nonsense is making it even worse.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's a terrible attitude. You shouldn't look down on people like that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's Early Retirement?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I agree. No one should be handed anything.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh do spare me your petty judgment. It's beneath me. Millions and millions of bits beneath me.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: By simply winning a lottery, those Early Retirees get an exclusive district of Byzantium to themselves. No one else is even allowed to go there.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Tell me, how is that fair?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: A random lottery seems pretty fair to me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well most contests have some inherent biases, so technically...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're right, it's not.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Life's not fair.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Only if I win it!

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's not right! I deserve to see any district I please! Why, if it weren't guarded, I'd...

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hmm... you know, you look like you've been shot at before. What say I hire you to investigate this travesty, and you get paid to do so?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why would I ever help you with something so selfish?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sure, I'll look into it.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Did you miss the part where I said I'd pay you? That's all the reason someone like you should require.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well it's not. Give me something better.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I do like money...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Doing it for the money would just make me selfish too. No thanks.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Better than money? Let's see, there's... no...

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: The thrill of discovery! Like in an aetherwave adventure. People love those, right? Don't you want to see what the Retirement District is like?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Fine. I'll do it, but not for the money.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Fantastic. Consider yourself employed, vagrant!

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: I hear the chosen retirees all enter the Retirement District via the port landing pad, but it's completely locked down. You'd never get in that way.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Unless, of course, you had a wealthy, beautiful benefactor of impeccable social pedigree. Which you do. How fortunate for you.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: These codes will get you past the lockdown. Oh, and don't worry about subtlety. I don't care how you deal with security, just correct this injustice at all costs!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How did you get those access codes?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll take care of it.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: The same way anyone gets anything here, of course. I made friends with the right people.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Bits might earn you a place in Byzantium, but that means everyone here has little need for more of them.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: For favors like this, you need to spend... let's call it social capital.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Now, do we have any further business or are you just here for the repartee?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I should go.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't see how, but very well. Frolic along then, you're blocking my view.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh by the law... I mean the principle of it, not the mechanics.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Exactly!

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well it should be if you pay enough!

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: The worst thing to happen to Halcyon - a contest that gives even the lowliest, most inefficient workers a chance to live in Byzantium.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yes, thank you! Goodness, what's the system coming to when unkempt vagabonds are making more sense than the Board itself?

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: I earned my place here, just like everyone else. My grandfather was the CIO at Tile, you see.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's a CIO?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wait, but what did you do to earn your place here?

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Chief Idea Officer. He came up with all the best ideas for their products. You know the font they use for Stogie Slims? That was him.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well he described the idea of it to their Font Development Team, then picked it from a list of choices, but that's basically the same thing.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: It was a very long list.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What other ideas did he come up with?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I see, thanks.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Let's see... he picked the colors they included in Rainbow Chips. No one else wanted purple, but he insisted. Everyone loves the purple ones.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: And you know how the Cosmic Smokes logo has an eye in the middle of a heptagon? He said that one came to him in a dream.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: He was a true visionary. So far ahead of his time...

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: You're welcome.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: I just told you. My grandfather made millions of bits as CIO, and I earned them from him.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Inheriting bits isn't the same as earning them.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Of course it is. Wealth is the most visible, objective measure of success, and success isn't given to you, it's earned. My grandfather taught me that.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: If you have wealth, you're successful, and if you're successful, you must have earned it. Honestly, it's a simple concept.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: A cystypig in a suit is still but a cystypig. Those clothes are obviously stolen, and you, sir, are still quite greasy.

dialog.speaker: HortenseIngalsbe (Female)
dialog.utterance: Ugh, how utterly expected. You must be one of those violent vagrants I've heard tell of - wandering the system in search of brutality.
